page.title: 10St Leonard's Church
page.content: In{Saxon}times in Hythe was a church. It might have just been St. Edmunds Chapel.{The Old Lympne Port}could not be used because it was silting up, so Hythe was formed and took over, so they got a bigger church. In about 1289 there was a storm which flooded the marsh which made the river change it direction which in turn made the harbour silt up. At this the town suffered plague and fire so there was a hold up and no more work was done on the church apart from making the arches bigger and adding a tower and porch. People often left money in their wills to keep a light burning in front of the statues of saints. At one time a landslide shook the tower so the bells rang, and the slide weakened the tower which caused it to fall, but soon after it was rebuilt using some of the original stones.
